intro: Diphasium complanatum, commonly known as the flat-leaved diphasium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its flat, broad leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale yellow in color. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
